page.title: 06WORSHIP IN BALLINDALLOCH
page.content: The Parish of Inveravon has one Church of Scotland church to which most of the people belong.Others worship at churches of their own denomination in neighbouring districts.While adults are attending the weekly service the children attend Sunday School in the vestry of the church. The church occupies a site which has been in religious use for many centuries, perhaps from as early as the 6th Century.In the 13th Century the Pre-Reformation church of St. Peter was built.Apparently it was so beautiful that a local name, Belleheiglash, is probably derived from both the Gaelic and French for "beautiful church". After the Reformation,that church was used for Protestant worship but was eventually replaced.The present church was built in 1806.
